snippet: Republican leaders called for investigation into the delay and some said the White House was trying to help Democrats by postponing the changes until after the midterm elections.
abstract: Obama administration's decision to delay enforcing pillar of health care law, mandate that large employers provide insurance benefits, raises new questions about government's preparedness to carry out landmark law and emboldens Congressional Republicans to open an investigation into the postponement.

byline.original: By JACKIE CALMES and ROBERT PEAR

lead_paragraph: Republican leaders called for investigation into the delay and some said the White House was trying to help Democrats by postponing the changes until after the midterm elections.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
